DRAINING.Definition: making them dry by removing water

MARSHLANDS.Definition: lands with low vegetation and shallow water, swamplands

DEFORESTATION.Definition: the action of clearing a large area of trees

CULTIVATING.Definition: preparing it to grow plants or crops

FERTILE.Definition: able to produce a large amount of plants or crops

PLOUGH.Definition: land that has been prepared to grow plants or crops

LANDSCAPE.Definition: the appearance of an area of land

INSULATED.Definition: covered it and stopped the heat from entering or escaping

INSULATING.Definition: covering it and stopping the heat from entering or escaping

AMATEUR.Definition: done in a not serious or professional way

PERIODIC.Definition: happening repeatedly over a period of time

EMISSIONS.Definition: acts of sending out gas or heat

IN PRINCIPLE.Definition: as a general idea, in general

METEOROLOGY.Definition: the study of the weather and the atmosphere

MEDDLING.Definition: involved in it as an outsider, without invitation

INTERFERING.Definition: involved in it as an outsider, without invitation

CREDENTIALS.Definition: documents that showed his qualifications and abilities

RELIABILITY.Definition: the quality of being able to be trusted

GLACIERS.Definition: large blocks of ice that that move slowly

SMOG.Definition: a mixture of smoke and gases that pollutes the air

FOG.Definition: thick cloud near the earth's surface

POLLUTANTS.Definition: substances that pollute or harm the environment

NIGHTFALL.Definition: the time when it became dark

VISIBILITY.Definition: the distance that one could see

ATTRIBUTED.Definition: considered as being the result of

PROOF.Definition: piece of information that showed it was true

OVERESTIMATED.Definition: considered them more important or serious than they were

UNDERESTIMATED.Definition: considered them less important or serious than they were

IN A BID TO.Definition: in an attempt to, trying to

DEPENDENCE.Definition: a situation in which they needed them

CONTROVERSY.Definition: a situation of disagreement and arguments

INFAMOUSLY.Definition: in a way that it is known for something bad

ACID RAIN.Definition: rain containing polluting or harmful chemicals

DENIERS.Definition: people who are not accepting the fact that it is real

HABITABLE.Definition: having the right conditions to live in

METEOROLOGIST.Definition: someone who studied the weather and the atmosphere

BLAMED.Definition: said that it was responsible for them

HOPELESSNESS.Definition: the feeling of having no hope

DESPAIR.Definition: the feeling that nothing can be done to improve the situation

LEVELLING OFF.Definition: remaining at a steady, stable level

LAB-GROWN.Definition: grown in a laboratory, not naturally

LIGHT AT THE END OF THE TUNNEL.Definition: signs of improvement and hope in the situation

NEGLECTED.Definition: not having received proper attention, disregarded
